messages.message:
:alarm::alarm::alarm::alarm:IB FLOW PARSER:alarm::alarm::alarm::alarm:
Team, happy to announce we have published 0.0.1 of the ibflowpaser (https://github.com/instabase/flow-parser) under an MIT license to leverage within our customers environments for solution development and troubleshooting.  This is an simple utility that takes flow log, parses each steps and groups them by the input records themselves. Give it a shot and provide feedback or bugs. I was able to find logs throughout different versions of IB but there will be edge cases.
https://github.com/instabase/flow-parser

A few things, firstly seems like due to the pandas dependency, this needs python 3.8+? I had issues when attempting to install to 3.7. Secondly, I presume this only works against JSON logs and not CSV logs? Third, should we be expecting to see warnings like below?

```❯ ibflowparser --input flow-job-logs-1694606399201.json -o parseout --output_type html
/Users/Chuba/.pyenv/versions/3.9.12/lib/python3.9/site-packages/numpy/lib/function_base.py:520: RuntimeWarning: Mean of empty slice.
  avg = a.mean(axis, **keepdims_kw)
/Users/Chuba/.pyenv/versions/3.9.12/lib/python3.9/site-packages/numpy/core/_methods.py:129: RuntimeWarning: invalid value encountered in scalar divide
  ret = ret.dtype.type(ret / rcount)```

Yes. I need to debug where that line is coming from. I believe it’s due to the rendering of ocr average and using the numpy average function. On the json front, yes only json however csv is an easy add just ran out of time atm
Also, unrelated to the minor issues: this rocks! Debugging time between steps has always been super tedious but often necessary, this is going to save so much time :slightly_smiling_face:
the features is very helpful, one of the thing that can be consider, if we want to compare two log side by side
